ch.aplu.tcpcom

Class TCPServer

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Thread
      • ch.aplu.tcpcom.TCPServer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public class TCPServer
extends java.lang.Thread
    Class to create a TCP server socket handled by event callbacks.

    • Constructor Detail

      • TCPServer

        public TCPServer(int port,
         boolean isVerbose)
        Creates a TCP socket server that listens on TCP port for a connecting client. The server runs in its own thread, so the constructor returns immediately. State changes invoke the callback onStateChanged().
        Parameters:
        port - the IP port where to listen (0..65535)
        isVerbose - if true, debug messages are written to TCPLog

      • TCPServer

        public TCPServer(int port)
        Same with isVerbose = false.
        Parameters:
        port - the IP port where to listen (0..65535)

        For internal use only

      • addTCPServerListener

        public void addTCPServerListener(TCPServerListener listener)
        Registers a TCPServerTCPLogistener to get state change notifications.
        Parameters:
        listener - the listener to register

      • isConnected

        public boolean isConnected()
        Returns true, if a client is connected to the server.
        Returns:
        true, if the communication link is establed

      • disconnect

        public void disconnect()
        Closes the connection with the client and enters the TCPLogISTENING state.

      • terminate

        public void terminate()
        Closes the connection and terminates the server thread. Releases the IP port.

      • isTerminated

        public boolean isTerminated()
        Returns true, if the server is in TERMINATED state.
        Returns:
        true, if the server thread is terminated

      • sendMessage

        public void sendMessage(java.lang.String msg)
        Sends the information msg to the client (as String, the character \0 (ASCII 0) serves as end of string indicator, it is transparently added and removed)
        Parameters:
        msg - the message to send
